info.headline: Rip Current Statement issued November 26 at 5:14AM CST until November 27 at 6:00AM CST by NWS Brownsville TX
info.description:
* WHAT...For the High Rip Current Risk, dangerous rip currents. For the High Surf Advisory, large breaking waves of 4 to 7 feet expected in the surf zone.
* WHERE...Kenedy Island, Willacy Island and Cameron Island Counties.
* WHEN...For the High Rip Current Risk, through 6 AM Thursday. For the High Surf Advisory, from 9 AM this morning to 8 PM this evening.
* IMPACTS...Dangerous swimming and surfing conditions and localized beach erosion. Rip currents can sweep even the best swimmers away from shore into deeper water.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS...The bulk of the elevated surf, onshore flow, and swell are expected to take place between high tide cycles, however, narrow beaches may become more narrow this afternoon into this evening and a Coastal Flood Statement may be needed.
info.instruction:
Inexperienced swimmers should remain out of the water due to dangerous surf conditions.
Swim near a lifeguard. If caught in a rip current, relax and float. Don't swim against the current. If able, swim in a direction following the shoreline. If unable to escape, face the shore and call or wave for help.

parameter.value: HIGH RIP CURRENT RISK REMAINS IN EFFECT THROUGH 6 AM THURSDAY... ...HIGH SURF ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 9 AM THIS MORNING TO 8 PM THIS EVENING

area.areaDesc: Kenedy Island; Willacy Island; Cameron Island
